title: Needleleaf Ericaceous Shrubs
name: needleleaf ericaceous shrubs
rationale: LightGBM provided the best quantitative performance. We removed the summer warmth and January minimum temperature covariates because of visible artifacts associated with the coarse resolution of those data.
description: The needleleaf ericaceous shrubs diagnostic species set consists of dwarf shrubs in the family Ericaceae that have persistent, needle-shaped leaves (see species list below). These species typically have prostrate, spreading growth forms and develop low mats. Empetrum nigrum is included within this diagnostic species set, in addition to being mapped independently. Needleleaf ericaceous shrubs are common and widespread throughout the map domain.
